item.title: PowerShell Profile & Functions
item.description: For those unfamiliar, the PowerShell profile (Microsoft.Powershell_profile.ps1) is the Windows PowerShell equivalent to the Linux and Mac OS .bashrc file, which loads when the terminal starts and allows user to save functions, aliases, and general shell settings between sessions. How-To Geek has a good article that covers how to set up a basic PowerShell profile, which I recommend reading before moving forward. All the code below can go in your PS Profile in any order, but Iâ€™ll present it in the order that makes the most sense to me.
